alert.note: Alert for Mendocino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 14 at 10:44PM PDT until March 15 at 7:00PM PDT by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and will continue * WHERE...Garcia River near Point Arena. * WHEN...Until 800 AM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Flooding in highway 1 along Gracia River near Point Arena is expected and the road will be closed. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1032 PM PDT, The Garcia River stage was 11.3 feet.Flooding is already occurring in the Highway 1 along the Garcia River. - Recent Activity....The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 PM PDT Tuesday was 14.24 feet. Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to 5.1 feet Wednesday morning. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Southwestern Mendocino County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
